description:
This is my go-to bagel place. It's in the 'Stro, mostly find parking here on during the week mornings.

Personally I always order the Cream cheese + Lox bagel. Very wel proportioned and they do give a lotta Lox. Thats what we like.

The pastries however are way to expensive in my opinion. Especially the little tiny morning buns. And to be honest, I have never seen them sold out. 

No Bueno people. The Castro is already so expensive.
author: Styn V.

description:
This is a very average bagel place. There's a variety of sandwich options and drinks available. The bagels don't look that appetizing in the case, but if they're warmed and all that they turn out pretty soft and fresh.

I got an eggwich with bacon on an everything bagel. It turned out okay, fair amounts of the ingredients. The only thing is the price was a little high for this product.
author: Spencer H.

description:
So we saw this on yelp and thought it was going to be a great breakfast but it was subpar. The bagels my husband and i got were around $5. I added a cronut and somehow our total ended up almost 19 dollars...
The bagels were kind of small but they were okay.
The service was fast but i Probably wouldn't come again seeing as there are cheaper bagel places with bigger sandwiches.
author: Alana B.

description: I love it. The bagel was amezing. The best of the best. I hope to cone agin. My was a Eggwich omlet. The bagel was a pesto bagel. The espreso was good . Good to start the day with a great breakfest.
author: Yael S.

description: This small store in the middle of the bumpin Castro has a wide selection of specialty bagels and spreads. It also has tons of bubble tea options. Perfect for a quick breakfast to grab and go. Wouldn't go to sit and eat.
author: Alex M.

description: Most overpriced and grossest bagel I've had in San Francisco. Not to mention the terrible customer service.
author: E M.

description: I love this Posh Bagel.  I don't care about the bad reviews and reputation. They have an awesome menu with so many options. It's owned by an Asian family, so they serve boba drinks too. I got the pizza bagel, and ohmy I love Posh Bagel's pizza bagels so much. However, I agree..It is a bit pricey.
author: Denise C.

description:
Perfect spot for a light lunch since I was in a rush. They have so many bagels to choose from but I ended up ordering the tuna melt with sesame bagel. It was really good except the big chunk of tomatoes on it.... I also got a doughnut to go, which was ehhhh!

I would definitely go back to try more of the bagels!
author: Glenn L.

description:
I didn't even finishing ordering when my boyfriend asked me to cancel because of the flies he saw on the bagels. Disgusting!

I was super excited for a lox bagel, to only be met with disappointment and a loss of appetite.
author: Simone T.

description:
Looking for Sunday brunch, but could not 'stomach' all the places with loud music.  Even outdoors!  Found the Post Bagel.  Quiet.  Warm.  Comfortable.  Reasonably priced.  Good Veggie Bagel sandwich.  Bagek was large and very fresh.  Great decaf coffee (Peet's?). And we were not charged extra for getting decaf, which seems to be happening more and more in other cafes.
Lots of  'regulars' seemed to come in for daily orders - a good sign.
author: K H.

description: Solid bagel place.  Been there several times now.  Always friendly, fresh, and fast.   Good options, and always good for bagel packs and tubs of cream cheese as a walk in.
author: Luke B.

description: Lunch on a Sunday. Disorganized. Worst service ever and they couldn't toast a bagel properly (didn't cut it in half).  They also gave me the wrong order. Will never go back.
author: Hilarie F.

description: Just had a delicious eggwich with ham on a pesto bagel! Unique bagel choices and was ready in minutes. Definitely coming back here!
author: Ryan S.

description:
The positives - I think the staff are very nice and very efficient. There are lots of good toppings for your bagel.

The negatives - I simply don't like their bagel texture. They are glorified soft, fluffy rolls formed into a bagel shape. The shop should be called "The Posh Kaiser Roll".

I think their product works better in a sandwich than in a morning bagel.
author: Scott B.

description: Loved these bagels! I got a dozen for friends staying with us and we all loved them! So so good! I'll definitely be back!
author: Samantha M.

description: We were given the wrong order today. When we. Fought it to their attention, they argued with us. Unacceptable.
author: Christopher W.

description: Attitude guy seems to be the owner . impolite behaviour and microwaved eggs on a croissant for $13.50 ????? Hell no . and the hummous !?!!?!! Store bought cheap stuff for $6 for 8 oz ??? In Castro ???? Kidding me ?????
author: manish c.

description:
Not sure why this place only has 3 stars, but this is my new go to place.

First and foremost - they use gloves. This is a major plus for me. Clean food over tasty unsanitary any day.

I usually get their chicken salad melt on Dutch crunch. At first I was like what did I order and wanted to change it, bc it sounds weird but it's very very tasty. Their bread is super soft to bite into, the melted Swiss with the warm chicken salad is amazing. It was a bit of a crunch from the celery and onion. They also don't put too much mayo in it which is a plus. It comes with a side of potato salad which is meh - the potatoes don't have the same texture as fresh boiled potatoes (maybe they are from a can?)

I've also gotten their egg and cheese breakfast croissant and their omelette breakfast sandwich on a croissant. Wish their omelette sandwich was more customizable - apparently the mix is pre made so you can get it without tomatoes or whatever u wouldn't want. 

I think this place is already great but would be even better if they also focused on the freshness of all their other ingredients besides their bagels and breads. Nonetheless a very good option for lunch if you are on Castro, and staff is nice, friendly and patient and tries to accommodate where they can.
author: Dipika S.

description:
Stepped in for a small Breakfast and got more than I expected. 
They have a big variety of different Bagels and they put on top of them whatever you want. 
I had a breakfast Onion Bagel with scrambled eggs and bacon to my berry smoothie and was satisfied. Before I left I ordered a plain one with avocado, cream cheese, tomatoes, onions and bacon for take out. 
Everyone was nice, the food was good and I would eat here again. 
Parking on the street in front of the store is also no problem and for San Francisco not expensive.
author: Corinna S.

description:
3.5 stars. The service here is the absolute worst. No one is friendly, and they get straight to business, demanding you to order even if you already have. Do not come here if you are looking for complimentary smiles and warm fuzziness with your morning coffee and bagel. 

With that said, Posh Bagel serves one of the best lox bagels I've ever had. For around $7, they pack tons of cream cheese and veggies into the bagel of your choosing. I would totally come back just for that, though sometimes they take awhile. On another positive note, this is a good music-less place if you are looking for somewhere quiet to get some reading done or work done while enjoying some food. And lastly... I really can't deny that hearing all their yelling in Chinese makes me feel a little at home.
author: Stefanie C.

description: Chinese people or Vietnamese people making bagels very unfriendly had to order two bagels because the minimum purchase on card is five dollars or more I ordered two sesame seed bagels toasted dark with garlic herb spread they put the spread on very thin I asked for a little bit more they wanted to charge extra when they already are barely putting some on both sides that are sliced in half I'll stick to NOAHS BAGELS GOR PRICE TASTE AND BETTER SERVICE THEY  DONT TELL US NO! The man in posh bagels told me to call the police because he could not refund my money I would never go there for food or refer them! Garlic speaks is nasty too I LOVE NOAHS FOR EVER! $8.11 for two Gross bagels
author: Jeannine P.

description: I was hungry and was running late in the morning. I had 7 minutes before the bus was to arrive. I just walked randomly one direction looking sir some breakfast sandwich and I came across this place that didn't look to busy at around 7:30am. From their easy to read menu with big fonts, I selected the the egg and ham in pesto bagel and the quiet, nice young lady heated it up for me. Luckily she finished and I paid for it. The chef man was in the background just watching over us. I grabbed my food and made it back to catch my bus. Later I ate my sandwich and it was just what I was looking for. Fulfilling and my tummy was happy. Good place to stop by when you are hungry and want something quick and fast to go.
author: Priscilla L.

description: The bagels are blah and the service is not friendly. I would probably not come back to this posh bagel location.
author: Sisse L.

description:
3 of us got bagels: the first is a chicken salad bagel. My friend says there's not a whole lot of flavor to it; it just kinda tasted like black pepper. It came on a sundried tomato bagel but can't taste a lot of the sundried tomato. Bagel was soggy because of the chicken salad.

Next was the turkey avocado melt. The ratio of ingredients was great but the bagel, again, was soggy. Asiago cheese flavor of the bagel was lost.

Lastly was bagel with lox. The lox was great but the tomato they used had a lot of inedible core to it. The bagel was bread-y but it did taste like an everything bagel.

The service was great; servers were friendly and dealt with the rush well. Honestly, we'll just get Philz bagels next time.
author: Daniel S.

description:
I can't add anything other than it's a bagel shop with a wide variety of bagels and toppings.  I've had better tasting bagels and spreads but it'll do in a pinch.
I paid $2.99 for a toasted sesame seed bagel with lite, veggie cream cheese.   The cream cheese wasn't very flavorful.  The few tables in the shop needed cleaning.
author: Thomas D.

description:
Impromptu stop for a bagel. MUST READ!
I ordered a bagel with cream cheese then paid for it. Afterwards she helped another customer. I, then realize, she DIDN't change her gloves after handling the cash register. Yuck!!!
Food and coffee are ok

Note: I just noticed that she's now handling the cleaning supplies and the attended the customers after without changing her gloves.
This will be reported to Health department!

Management need to provide training.
author: Zippi B.

description:
Here at The Posh Bagel, you get white glove treatment. No really.

Yesterday, the ambivalent cashier girl is sitting there counting my cash change out to me. With her same latex gloves on, goes into the back toaster oven and proceeds to smear the schmear on my bagel, bags it up, and hands it to me.

I'm glad to know her hands were protected from germs the whole time. My own stomach lining, not so much. Unsanitary and against health code. And just plain frickin' gross.

I only really realized it had occurred after I got my bag which was a too late to make a scene over.

I really hate to say it, but the marinara bagel with chive cream cheese was still awesome with my coffee. I was hungry. :'(
author: Jared R.

description:
Been here several times since my last review and they are greatly improved! Clean, comfortable, friendly, fresh! 

Back to being one of my favorite spots on Castro. 

#onionbagel w/tomato & cream cheese. So fresh it doesn't need toasting. 
#icedcoffee
#bagelsandwiches
author: Steven B.

description:
a wonderful gem. we walked in, very hungry, after visiting and walking around mission dolores park. we were amazed at the possibilities! hubby had a breakfast bagel and i had bagel and lox. hubby's bagel sandwich was great, his coffee was very good and my bagel was out of this world delicious - no scrimping on anything.

the service was great and friendly.  we rarely visit the castro, but next time we do, we'll know exactly where to go for a bite!
author: Diane C.

description: Nah . this are buns dressed up as bagels . the staff is Chinese . Chinese are not bagel experts . they microwave there eggs and the " bagel" . to make a mushy steamy not very flavourful sandwich .
author: David M.

description:
It's ok. The bagels are actually quite good. 

Why the meh? They barely toast the bagel, they also have communications issues so you don't always get what you ask for, and they are pretty slow and disorganized. 

If you are up for the frustration of ordering in order to get a good if under-cooked bagel then this is the place to go.
author: Dave O.

description:
Posh is an exaggeration. HUGE exaggeration.

This place is a mess. The floors were dirty and sticky and all the tables were gross with crumbs or spills left unattended, various trash strewn all over. I felt like everything here has a film over it--the pastry cases all look hazy and greasy. 

The last time I was here, the new counter girl was being screamed at by a veteran bagel slicer and she was calling her stupid over and over. I felt really bad for her. 

Was my bagel good? Yes. It wasn't anything special, but it was tasty.

The service and the atmosphere left much to be desired.
author: Bianca U.

description: Hands down the coldest service on Castro, I regretted that I ordered from here just choosing the bagel type. So sad
author: Luski G.

description:
Bagels are not chewy and have no density.  They are like wonder bread in the shape of a bagel.  I can eat a good bagel with just butter or cheese, not this bagel! Also it is very, very salty!

The sandwiches looked good, but this review is about the bagels!
author: D H.

description: Have been here several times in the morning for breakfast ordering an egg bacon cheese bagel, first time I ordered it I thought they just messed up because literally there was a flake of egg on the bagel like they didn't get it all out of the plastic container after nuking it, 2nd time I watched the woman pour the egg mix into bowl to nuke and again it was a sliver of liquid so I said could u put some more in there which she did but then charged me extra for adding extra egg and it still didn't even equal one egg! The eggs are also extremely watered down, no flavor,they cut corners wherever they can and the bagels are meh, no mas para me!
author: maria c.

description:
Cheap, fresh, tasty bagels. Wide variety of fillings and types of bagels. With a choice of hot and cold drinks and pastries (Danish, croissants etc).

Nice service. 

Toilet had no toilet roll (even after a customer told the server she didn't replace it). That's the only bad point - at least it had a toilet though!
author: Stephanie O.

description: This place is incredibly over priced. The bagels aren't really that good and they put way too much cream cheese on them.
author: Sara W.

description:
Good everything bagel. 

Depressing as all hell. Get it to go.
author: Emily D.

description: AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE! Came here by accident, ordered a wrap, went to the restrooms to wash my hands, WOW WOW WOW! Didn't feel like eating (neither using the restrooms) after that. It was disgusting, not like something happened more like they've NEVER cleaned it. Sadly you can't use the restrooms if you don't order something so you'll have to trust me, DO NOT GO THERE.
author: Olivia M.

description: They are quite good, a bit pricey, haven't really figured out exactly wot makes them Posh apart from their 'Specialty' bagels such as the Tomato Marinara one or the Pesto bagel, which I guess the likes of Noahs don't have.
author: Julian I.

description:
I'm gonna go with the ownership may have changed or is absentee?

Your help isn't much, if turning the register display to me and saying nothing throughout my order is good enough, well try some paint and regular habits that come from pride of ownership.

Seems like the place is on auto-pilot, headed for a bad landing.
author: Neal M.

description:
San Francisco is full of bagel shops but to be honest I don't generally sit down for a breakfast lunch or dinner meal consisting of bagels alone. I may grab a half a dozen bagels every now and then but I rarely spend time eating at a bagel shop munchin' bagels.
 They say the first rule of business is location location location and this place is located at the corner of 18th and Castro making a window seat meal a potentially entertaining way to spend a few hours.
author: Kevin I.

description:
No, just no.

The service is not very friendly or accommodating. When I ask to please toast my bagel longer/slower, I receive an annoyed response.  But if I do not specify this, my bagel is always cold which is not how I like my toasted bagels.  
I understand that the way they make their bagels is what has been specified, but I just do not understand the San Francisco method of slicing the schmeared bagel in half, to eat like a sandwich?  They only put schmear on one side of the bagel then do this, and I think that it must be done to cut back on cost.  
I am critical of my bagels because I love them, and want SF to have better bagel options!
author: Lyndsey L.

description:
When you're broke and hungry, the cheap plain or specialty bagels come in handy. Just plain, nothing on them like cream cheese or anything. I always grab the spinach one and walk down to Castro coffee for a mini combo that's about $2:50. Breakfast couldn't be easier. 

Otherwise, not really the best place overall, not too friendly, and I don't particularly like when they grab the bagels with the same gloves they use to count and deal with money in the cash register. Let's be sanitary folks. 

Again, get a bagel in the morn, and call it a day.
author: Manny S.

description: I love this place. I've been going here on occasion for the past 7 years and although I don't know anyone by name and I don't believe that they know mine and that they are in no way uniquely personal to me, I do find them fast, friendly and efficient.
author: Wyatt B.

description: The bagel itself was fine, but they have few vegan options. I settled on peanut butter, only to find out that they only put it on one side of the bagel. When I asked for both sides of the bagel I was told pretty rudely that it cost more. So for the price of a bagel with peanut butter you only get half a bagel with peanut butter, and not enough to eat it closed face. Stingy and cheap, definitely not worth the cost. $0.50 for about 1 tablespoon of peanut butter even in this city is a little insane.
author: Erica M.

description: Ordered a Caesar salad wrap. I enjoyed all the flavors of a salad in a wrap. $7.50 for two halves. Saved the other half for breakfast--good deal.
author: Trisha C.

description: I get one thing here but it's always very good, as they bake their own bread - and have the best dutch crunch in town. I order the turkey and bacon with avocado on dutch crunch with all the veggies including sproats. Mayo, hold the pickles & mustard. Seriously delish sandwich!
author: Josie J.

description: The bagel was fresh and tasty. They don't skimp on the spread which is nice if you like your bagel rich & creamy.  It's comparable to "Bagel Me".
author: Tam L.

description:
pretty much your straight up bagel deli.  
Tasty bites, and a simple menu.  Few frills, at a no frills price
author: Matt V.

description: How the never mighty have fallen more. I don't know what it is but the staff just seems so disinterested , and even when it's not busy being asked my order like five times for clarification always seems sketchy. Bagel sandwiches should NEVER have actual condiment choices you'd have for an actual sandwich unless I suppose it does have deli meats on it. But lox sandwiches with sprouts and other accoutrements ? It just breaks cardinal rules of bagel engagement
author: Lauren V.

description:
I am giving Posh Bagels on Castro a 2 star review because of the service which depending on which person serves you at the counter is completely inconsistent  as is their inability to open on time.  They have a posted opening time of 6am, yet on the completely random mornings I decided to forgo a quick breakfast at home and have a bagel sandwich I find that about 30% of the time they are still not open as late as 6:30am.  There are no other open options in the neighborhood for hot prepared breakfast.  This is extremely frustrating.

I do really enjoy their eggwich bagel breakfast sandwiches on the days they can manage to be open though.
author: Curtis J.

description:
Quality is not all there- It is "acceptable", but nothing in there will ever even BEGIN to blow you away.  But the worst part: the staff hardly cares about what you're ordering. They're going to make what THEY want to make for you, end of story.  You can tell them your order in the slowest, clearest manner, even the most simple order of your life, and it will not be correct. Upon correction of your order, they will not even make you a brand new order, but will "wipe-off" whatever it is that you didn't ask for, and slap on whatever it was you had actually asked for, causing a mixture of flavors and residue of items in your food making it simply NOT what you wanted. Gross!!!!!!!!!!!

Their wide selection of bagels and menu items and bubble tea offerings saves them from a 1-star rating.
author: Haliegh S.

description: I had a standard deli sandwich on an everything bagel. It was pretty good, very filling, and a good deal. I would recommend stopping here if you are looking for a quick and easy bite to eat. It seems like they have quite a few different options for bagels, the pizza bagels looked really good.
author: Andrew H.

description:
So many bagels to eat, and so little time. Not really too posh, and my sesame seed bagel + cream cheese was OK. The green tea ice tea was freshly brewed, and they didn't have regularly brewed ice tea. So in Olympic week parlance, that would be a wobble in their routine, and a 9/10th deduction. 

I would come back as long as that  tall old naked guy you see walking around Castro showing off his small weenie, didn't sit on my seat.
author: Reyz A.

description:
Pretty reasonable prices, pretty good food. 

Nothing worth bragging home to mama but it was okay. I would come here once again when I am hungover and want carbs.

mmm carbs....
author: Ezequiel R.

description:
Has anyone ever seen the episode of Seinfeld with the "Soup Nazi"? Well, here's a story for you. 

I decided to try Posh Bagel for the first time a couple days ago. I said "eh, what the hell" it's on my way to work anyway. I walk in and the chick at the counter looks at me and immediately looks away. She doesn't greet me in any way because she was busy helping one other person before me. Whateves, no biggie. So I wait like a good girl. Finally, when it's my turn, the chick asks me what I'd like. I told her I wanted the  Eggwich with bacon. Then she asks (this is totally what it sounded like to me anyway) "what kind a bacon you wand?" I'm thinking to myself "what kind of bacon" do I want?? Hmmmm maybe they offer turkey bacon too?? So I asked her questioningly, "what kind of bacon??"
This must have really pissed her off because she screamed "BAY-GOOOOOOOOOO!!!!!!!!" Oh shit, she meant BAGEL. Whoops, my bad!! I couldn't understand because she had a heavy accent. After that, I waited again like a good girl while she made my Bay-go, got my wallet out, took my cash out so I'd be ready to pay, slid my way to the front of the register when she was done making my Bay-go, handed her the cash, didnt make eye contact, took my Bay-go, did an "about face" and walked out the door. Just like in Seinfeld. I ordered and got the hell out of there. It was pretty facking hilarious :)
author: Sumiko G.

description: A lot of times when I break down and go back here the whole place smelled like pungent cleaning supplies had been hosed all over the place, so much that it burned your eyes and throat.  Nice.  A couple times I've been here a girl wearing gloves took my money in her gloved hand - her gloved hand! - and then used that "clean gloved hand" to make bagels.  Mmmm.  Thanks!  I go to the Dolores Park Cafe now, when I have time for the several blocks walk.
author: Amy M.

description: I used to live down the street. I thought the place was good - not 5 stars but that changed this morning... I didn't catch his name, but there was a friendly face who was setting up shop at 6:00. I arrived in a rush, and needing to get a large order filled for a morning meeting. The employee helped me to the car to load, was super quick in selection of my bagels... And all while being  friendly. It was really above and beyond and helped start my day on a high note. Awesome customer service makes the difference. Also just to flag, they open at 6:30 - not 6:00.
author: SHOOTING S.

description: Pretty quick, good flavored bagels and healthy serving of cream cheese. The prices- eh? I paid about 7 bucks for a Nantucket nectar and a bagel with cream cheese with added bacon- the bacon was over cooked and super thin- boo. The girls working were of some Asian descent, there is a language barrier and they are not rude but, there is something lacking- one man joked about making his 20 dollar bill fresh this morning and the cashier just looked at him, at least a fake laugh would be suffice. Another man came to order and he was pointing at the glass of which bagel he wanted, rather than to go look and see she asked him which one about 4 times. It was quick and. I had my bagel in just moments. Might come back or just succumb to Noah's.
author: JL S.

description:
This place was the worst Posh Bagel location ever. The girls behind the counter barely spoke English and were rude at that. I ordered a sandwich and noticed as she was making it the bread looked as hard as a rock. Then as she went to add on the meat it looked sour and lettuce was wilted. At this point I already had paid but watching the preparation of my meal I was immediately turned off. As she continued to make it I thought to myself this is not going to work. I then asked her to cancel my order......she refused.....did not give me my money back and got confrontational. 

I asked for the managers name and she on purposely mumbled it "in her poor attempt at English voice" so I could not understand. 8$ is not worth it to come back and haggle with a manager I find this Yelp review to be a better way to express my feelings. What ever happened to the customer is always right. I have been to the Posh Bagels in Oakland before and it was fine but never again will I patron Posh Bagels on Castro!
author: Nelvia A.

description: Bagels are good but the service leaves something to be desired. The women behind the counter are unbelievably rude!
author: Shanah K.

description:
Posh is a place you can depend on to grab a quick bagel - except for when it's late and they are running out of the ones you want to eat.

Where I got my bagel preferences:
Mother - Poppy
Math Teacher (Calculus) - Egg

Have you wondered lately, where do your preferences come from?
author: Will C.

description:
This is really a 3.5, but what the hey, I come here almost every weekend. I have to say, it took a while to acquire the taste. My boyfriend really enjoys bagel eggwich sandwiches, so he takes me here. The bagels are standard-tasting to me and not that great, but it does the job.

What I'll give a much higher rating for is not what they are known for... their non-bagel options! Their dutch crunch bread is super flaky/buttery and if you get their turkey avocado melt on dutch crunch, it is heaven. Just don't expect it to be easy on your hips.

Also, the girls that work here are super nice. I'm not sure what other posters meant...
author: Sylvia L.

description: I love the bagels here. They are delicious, perfectly toasted and have great spreads to choose from to take it to that next level. The only reason I cannot give this location 5 stars is due to customer service. They don't smile, and are very short and dry with you. Also, I feel like I have to repeat my order 2 or 3 times each time I visit because they don't understand me.
author: Bradley V.

description:
After our disastrous visit to The House of Bagels, The Posh Bagel was  a pleasant surprise.  We had 20 minutes to wait for Hot Cookies to open, so we decided to snack on bagels while waiting.

I had an Everything Bagel with cream cheese & it was heaven.
Seriously, I'm a bagelholic & this bagel was one of the best I've ever had.
$2.
author: Lynette T.

description: I go here literally every day. This place is solid. Blueberry bagel with egg, jack cheese, and avacado is incredibly good. Don't get the coffee here though, go to Castro Coffee Company instead.
author: Michael L.

description: I have been working in the Castro 1 year now and I never really thought about going here because it's bagel shop & who gives a rats A$$ about boring bagels. But I walked by this morning and my spider senses went off and I smelled something delicious so I had to stop, I walked in as someone was ordering and asked what it was, he told me and it sounded like crap. So I started to look at the menu and thought a ( curse aunt = croissant) sounds good and thought again what if I asked for ham / cheese / bacon would they do it. The girl explained to me it would ham and cheese is X amount of dollars and adding bacon would be extra I said of course that's fine. Blah blah blah got my sammich ( Spell check ) now at work and it was good I think this is going to be my new spot !!
author: C D.

description: One "gourmet" Asiago Cheese bagel w/ a smear of whipped cream = $3.50+/-   I'd rather walk into Noah's where the same order would behalf the price!  Also, there wasn't anything distinct or exceedingly delectable about product/taste.  It wasn't horrible or bland but not worth the dough ;-)
author: Honest J.

description:
Nasty, puffy ass bagels. Bares no resemblance to the dense chewy magic that are NY bagels. 

The cream cheese is, as well, funky with a strange sweetness that made me toss the whole mess in the garbage after 2 bites.

theres no place like home.. there's no place like home...
author: Luis F.

description: The breakfast bagels are good BUT.......... sigh.... if only ALL the employees who are putting together the morning sandwiches and then ringing you up , would REMOVE their gloves when handling the money.. HELLO RESTAURANT OWNER.. please train your employees on food handling.. the plastic gloves are not there to protect their hands, but rather PROTECT the customers from cross contamination.... I recently visited the place, ordered a morning sandwich ..... was going ok at first, until I saw one of the servers make a sandwich and then , keeping her gloves on.. tender the person's money...... geez........ S.F. restaurant owners get your clean standards up....... where's the health department in this town.. It's time eateries had to put a health department grade outside their window...........
author: Franco L.

description:
I am pretty easy to please.

When it comes to sandwiches, nothing is better than a simple hot bagel roll piled high with turkey, swiss cheese, lettuce, cucumbers, sprouts, and slices of avocado. 

I don't care if there are ALWAYS solicitors in front of this place, or that the clientele leaves a lot to be desired, or that the staff behind the counter may or may not speak English. I also don't care that I'm spending $8 for a sandwich, or that there's a breadline "in n' out" atmosphere in this joint. 

I just care about my avocado. And Posh keeps it highbrow by loading it on for only 50 cents more. 

And authentic or not, I care about and appreciate the fact that the bagel roll does not require a hacksaw to break through. It's soft and easy on my jaw, which tends to pop out of place if overly stressed. That means any date I bring here cares too, which is good, because it goes both ways and I too aim to please.
author: Devon S.

description:
Bought chocolate milk, poppyseed bagel and watermelon. Chocolate milk was good, but the store can't really take credit for that. Bagel was decent but not particularly great.

Watermelon? Most overpriced item and sour. Also gag-inducing. I think it had actually gone bad. To top it off, I think it was one of the more expensive items purchased. 

Would have been a 3-star if they weren't overcharging for watermelon that had gone bad.
author: Jay K.

description: Not sure why everyone is so focused on the interior - the energy is obviously put into their baking because these bagels are damn good.  I crave Posh on a pretty regular basis, so thank you for being right down the street.
author: Laura K.

description: I have to be at work early in the morning and really like posh bagel's eggwiches but this place is never open on time and when it is, their bagels aren't ready until another 30-45 minutes after opening. Service is horrible!!
author: Manuel Y.

description:
Just fine - what can I say? They are polite, but not too friendly here.

The food is good - not amazing, but definitely not bad.

Espresso is good. I don't mind picking up an americano here!
author: Jason B.

description: Fast and friendly enough, but the girls behind the counter did not change gloves in between customers or after handling money or cash register. They helped six people while I was there and no glove changes.
author: Jesse W.

description:
Yeah, I guess I agree with the name vs. decor comments...

However, they never fail to serve up a great chicken salad supreme sandwhich. I get mine on a roll as its packed with great stuff like avocado and cucumbers, but if in a bagel, it will get everywhere! Maybe thats a good thing though :)
author: Allen B.

description: I come here every once in awhile on the weekends when I want a quick breakfast. The bagels are pretty good, nothing to write home about, but pretty good. Whenever I order butter on my bagel, they put the smallest amount. They put on a normal sized smear of cream cheese, but they only let the butter kiss the bagel. A silly complaint, but it's a bit of a pain.
author: Jeremy J.

description:
They offer a lot of different bagels, but I really should have just stuck with a regular bagel with flavored cream cheese to mix things up a bit. Instead, I chose a Hot Chicken Breast Bagel: at least it seemed like they give you a ginormous bagel sandwich, since they make good use of BOTH sides of the bagel and layer both top and bottom with meat and cheese. Chicken breast lacked flavor and the slices were thin, so it was really dry/hard after being toasted. The cheese was on top (it gives you cheesey teeth when you bite into it b/c you cannot stack both sides of the bagel and open your mouth that wide, at least I can't), no veggies except a slice of tomato. I should have added on extra veggies, I wanted lettuce and sprouts. Which was only evident on the cold bagel sandwiches or regular sandwiches. 

I came too late in the afternoon, because I had to resort to a marinara bagel (didn't taste any marinara flavor at all) instead of the spinach or sun dried tomato bagel that I wanted to try. The pesto bagel was the same, maybe using the bagels to make a sandwich masks the flavor of the bagel. The bagel sandwiches are pretty bland in general. They need some type of flavored spread or a little somethin' somethin'...

P.S. They offer a bunch of Naked juices, Snapple, Java City coffee, and lots of other juices, fountain soda, etc.
author: Tracy T.

description: It'll do.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
I wanted something healthier today since last night my BFF Natalie and I had a gluttonous paradise at Sparky's.
Enter Posh Bagel.
I thought that a Nutri Melt (tomatoes, sprouts and melted cheese [I chose provolone] on a bagel [I chose an everything bagel]) sounded healthier than most of the alternatives on this street.
It just wasn't as tasty.
Everything was fresh but it definitely needed a little "something".
Like salt, fat or bacon (which is basically salt and fat mixed with pork-flavored love, right? Ed back me up on this!).
I enjoyed it not very much but it did fill me up. Which may or may not have been something eating a calorie free meal of cardboard (cardboard IS calorie free right? But high in fiber?) could accomplish.
Doubtful I'll be back.
author: Jill D.

description: We eat here about 3x a week and have grown to like it.  This isn't a bagel from NYC, this is definitely a West Coast bagel.  They make it quick and they are all very nice, but tend to charge a different price everytime if you order veg or something else on the bagel.
author: Suzie R.

description:
Sadly, it is true.  This is the only bagel shop in the Castro.  If you want just a bagel and cream cheese (and ask them to lighten up on the cream cheese), then you should be safe.  The breakfast egg bagel sandwiches, however, leave a bit to be desired.  There's nothing worse than being able to tell before even biting into it, that the egg was poured out of a carton.  That, combined with the overcooked bacon, ham, or sausage makes the breakfast sandwiches something likened to gummi candies. It does the job for a quick breakfast on the go, but...only when it's absolutely necessary.   But buy your beverage elsewhere.  Never have I paid more than $1.75 for a bottle of Vitamin Water, but here, they gouge you!

Never mind the food, my experience yesterday was appalling.  4 dogs, with their owners in this food establishment.  Don't get me wrong, I like dogs, but just not where I'm ordering food.  The man I assumed to be the owner just ignored the fact that they were all corralled in the middle of the store.   Isn't that a health code violation or am I missing something?  

I won't lie, I'll probably get food here at some desperate point in the future, but as I said...it's a last resort.
author: Selena F.

description: Came here on 1/14/12 as we had a craving for Cinnamon Rolls.  So we got Cinnamon rolls and they were just blah and not so great.  We've been to this place for the occasional bagel from time to time.  Not much more to say but this place is just OK.
author: Arthur Z.

description: The shop interior is definitely not posh, but the food is delish.
author: Stephen V.

description:
I hate to do this, as I eat there twice a week pretty much every week, but I don't like this location very much.

Maybe its just me, but I don't need an inch and a half of cream cheese on my bagel. And again, maybe its just me, but if i get a bagel sandwich or veggies on it, I would like them to be in between the bagel halves and not smushed between the bagel and the paper its wrapped in.

All that negative stuff said, I like Posh Bagel in general. I love the "gourmet" bagels, and really, for the selection the price is not that bad. When you start getting the sandwiches is when it gets pricey, but my average lunchtime charge is under $5, and I'm always full.

I will also mention that the Sutter location is my favorite. I think I'll go write them a review now....
author: Vanessa R.

description:
Food: 2
Service: 3
Decor: 2
Atmosphere: 1

On the basis of the other reviews, I dropped in this morning while running errands and ordered their "Bagel Omelet".  This is basically a breakfast bagel with egg, cheese, tomatoes, onions, and green peppers.

What a waste of $4.59.  The "omelet" portion of the bagel was pre-made: they threw it in the microwave, nuked it for 30 seconds, and then popped it onto the bagel (which was at least toasted after I ordered).  This omelet was totally tasteless.  The bagel itself was light and pleasantly salty, but again devoid of any real flavor - and I ordered their "everything" bagel.

This is bagel fast food and I won't be back.
author: Nate B.

description: This place smells so good from the street.  The problem is the bagel's.  Dry and flavorless. They would do better with Costco bagels.
author: EC N.

description:
When I think "posh", I think classy, elegant, fashionable, or the former Spice Girl. None of these terms applied to the restaurant, nor did they apply to my bagel sandwich, and Victoria Beckham was nowhere to be found.

I had a sudden burst of hunger while I was on the metro, and I decided to hop off in the Castro for a snack. I always eat Hot Cookie and Thailand Restaurant, so my quick stop ended up being The Posh Bagel. 

When the girl was making my order, she managed to drop all of my tomato and avocado off the edge of the bagel, and onto the top of the toaster. Instead of remaking my snack, she picked up all the toppings and just put them back on top. 

Gross!
author: Taylor S.

description:
Look, just don't go in expecting good bagels like one gets back East.
I had a waaaaaaay better bagel wrapped in plastic and plucked from under a heat lamp at JFK, but...

Posh serves its purpose -- it's totally bagel fast food, the other peeps are right...

Specifically, Posh stands out as a GREAT hangover comfort.  An Eggwich with sausage on an everything bagel and a nap and I'm good to go.

I also dig the cinn.-raisin with peanut butter.  Yum.

And the staff are actually very efficient and nice.
author: Dwayne A.

description: I keep going back here every so often hoping that it will have gotten better, but it hasn't. If you just need some empty carbs in the form of an ok tasting bagel it's fine. But beyond that it lacks in many areas. "Service with a smile" appears to be a concept only. I had a garden burger on a bagel the other day and I stopped eating it as the micro-waved burger was ok in the middle, but the edges were hard as a rock. It probably was past its prime! The bagels served with the garden burger ALWAYS fall apart. Not a sign of a good bagel. So, hopefully I've learned my lesson and will give it a skip in the future.
author: M G.

description: I eat here quite a lot - pretty much every morning after the gym.  They have great a great eggwich with sausage - usually get it on an Asiago, Marinara, or Poppy bagel.  Although no place will ever be like H&H Bagels in NYC, this place has really tasty food.  They could smile a bit more behind the counter, but they are usually on top of things and keep the line moving quickly.
author: Sean R.

description:
I worked down the street for two years so I've had my share of daily visits to this bagel shop. I've had pleasant experiences for the most part, usually with the older Asian man helping me. He always was sweet and I never had to wait long for my "cream cheese with a side of bagel."

There was one instance that turned me off and I tried not to go there as frequently as I used to. I placed an order for a breakfast sandwich (scrambled eggs, bacon, cheese on an asiago bagel) with one of the ladies behind the counter (the grumpy one that always has that sour look on her face, the same one that talks shit under her breath? ya, you know who I'm talking about.) and she had it wrapped up and put in a paper bag a minute later.

I take the bagel back to work and realize that she had given me a sausage and egg on a CHOCOLATE CHIP BAGEL. WTF. I head back over and let her know that my order was wrong and she looked at me like  she wanted to climb over the counter and beat me. Then she yelled, "YOU SAID A BREAKFAST BAGEL ON CHOCOLATE CHIP!"

Now, I'm a nice person ... but she done f'ed up now. So then I start freaking out because ... come on ... chocolate and eggs? 

As I begin taking my earrings off, tie my hair back and start rubbing vaseline on my face ... the nice man that usually helps me out starts the new order and apologizes profusely for the mistake. 

I still wanna sock that girl in the neck but still ... 3 stars cuz I got my bagel in the end from the nice man.
author: Joyce S.

description:
I love Posh! It was one of the first places I ate at in SF when I'd come to visit and swoon. I totally love the sesame seed bagel with lox spread. When I was looking for apartments, this was about the only place I'd eat. From Menlo Park to the Financial district. My gf would get the veggie sandwich and I'd get  my lox sesame seed bagel. We'd also share some "Dirty's" potato chips. Something funny -- Dirty's is a Louisiana company but there it's called Zapp's. And the flavor called "Cajun" out here is called "Crawfish Flavor" in Louisiana.

Anyway, I ate there until I burned out..but I'll probably have it again sometime soon.
author: Chrissy Q.

description: Decent food; service, what's that? It's only out of convenience more than anything else that you would want to go here. The service, i.e., when they shout at you to take your order, glare when they take your money and fail to thank you when you pay, leaves much to be desired. And it's not just me, everyone gets shouted at and made to feel that you've inconvenienced their day. They are fast and the food is filling (and pricy). Yes, a place with killer location like theirs can float along with conditions like these, but you have to wonder why they're not sunnier or nice because they're missing the opportunity to make hand over fist (look around the corner at Starbucks). Maybe because it's so dark inside that they can't see you or maybe it's because their refrigerators and drink coolers drone on so loudly you can barely hear yourself think let alone them hearing your order. Anyway, if you want better bedside manner, you have to go to Starbucks around the corner, where the staff really does go out of their way to be nice to their clients. Yes, Posh Bagels offers a little more variety than Starbucks which is the only reason why I would go there because I would otherwise -- and do -- get my drinks and quick snacks around the corner at our Lady of Starbucks.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Yes, I'll take an Eggwich please!

Perfect MUNI snack on the way to school.
author: David M.

description:
My turkey-and-cranberry bagel was a short stack of joy. This thickness made it slightly challenging to bite into, as the perfectly toasted bagel was packed with fresh veggies (L, T, and sprouts!), a layer of cold cream cheese that was just-right in thickness, and the folds of sliced turkey which, in reality, were quite average, but were made into worthy sidekicks to the real star of the show-- the cranberry sauce. Of which there was neither too little nor too much.

With all the layers this bagel had, it's amazing that it turned out with such a perfect balance of nuances. Whoever put it together must be some kind of bagel genius. The people behind the counter were both very pleasant, so I'm not surprised.

*Minus one star for me. Because I was indecisive, and I didn't know what kind of bagel I wanted as I waited in line, and I ended up ordering a regular cheddar bagel. And later I realized that I should have gotten the more exciting apple bagel.

*Plus one star. Because there's always next time.
author: Le V.

description: I went inThe lady behind the counter is very rude and snappy with a lot of attitude.I love the food but they really need to pick people who are more personalabl.That's why it's always empty inside.If you ask them to make your bagel a certain way they look pissed off like your putting them out.Never a "hi may I help you" or "thank you."Just bad service!The people also don't know how to make coffee drinks which is misleading because they offer them.Just plan bad service! :(
author: Andrea C.

description: Pesto w cream cheese my fav. ( dont let them put one inch cream cheese:) .Taste is good,service is just ok.But u can pay 2-3 bucks to have breakfast even in subway.Costumer service needs to be better.The only truth is they'r hella fast :) i m between 3 stars to 4 ....got my *3.5 *
author: Ozzy D.

description: the best posh bagel in the city.. its cheaper for some reason then the other posh bagels in the city.. but there always fast.. didnt give five stars for the robot like customer service..
author: nancy w.

description:
Fast and furious service. As for the staff - they do speak English (or at least "bagel menu.").  It's not gourmet food, my friends. It's a friggin' short-order bagel shop -- Very convenient. Maybe I'm just too tired to tell the difference that early in the morning...   They run out of bagels quickly for a reason (because it's the only bagel shop in the area). 
So for a bagel shop in the Castro... '4"
author: Matt R.

description: The perfect way to start a morning.   A breakfast bagel with all the extras.  Yummy.  Service is never exceptional, but the food is a good way to start.  I do say skip the coffee and go to Peets instedad.
author: Jim H.

description: its a touch more expensive than i think it should be but it is fast with a wide selection of bagels available. I get a standard egg and cheese bagel on poppyseed or everything. and when i leave i always wish i'd have ordered two instead of one.
author: Robert E.

description: Pretty good bagel sandwich, but the price was inflated and the place wasn't to memorable.
author: Haz O.

description: They're a decided improvement over Noah's travesties, although not quite as good as House of Bagels on Geary. If the whitefish salad truly is imported from Brooklyn, I can only hope it's shipped on a ton of ice for next-day delivery.
author: Gourmet G.

description:
i do not think that whoever named posh bagel, knew what the word posh meant.  or else they would have named it "homeless guy taking up 3 tables bagel" or "im hungover and im hungry bagel" or even "why do they sell pineapple here bagel" 

in any case, i love it. its great. it has 400 varieties of bagels. 
my favorite is the whole wheat sesame seed. 
check it out.
author: shae t.

description: TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE: after ordering a bagel and trying to pay with my debit card I was told the minimum was $3 for cards. I explained I didn't have any cash on me and, if they had had a sign up with that policy, I would have gone to the ATM before. No only was there no sign, but minimum charge requirements like this are against many credit card companies agreements with the business. Sadly, now I'm out $3 for a $1.50 bagel that, having lived from New York, isn't even worth $0.25. :-(
author: Ian H.

description: The bagels are above average for the west coast and the whitefish salad is imported from Brooklyn so all is good.
author: patrick g.

description: This place is dirty.  The girl who was making bagels sneezed into her hands and went right back to making bagels without washing her hands.  And they're rude there.
author: Anthony F.

description: I work on the next block over at a local yoga studio. Since I was early one day for my shift, I stopped in here to get a bagel with cream cheese. Happy to find that they sold Naked juice, I started off with a good impression. The people working there were nice, but the bagel itself was pretty dry, even after being toasted - seemed like it had been sitting there all day. House of Bagels or even Noahs has better bagels, but it worked for the time being.
author: Victoria K.

description: Big points for understanding that "light" cream cheese means "thinner than the height of my hand".  I've always been impressed by how Posh Bagel does so much with so few cooking facilities, and yet everything is good.
author: Jude F.

description: This place is a good one if you are in a hurry.  Be sure to look them in the eye when placing your order...
author: Target T.

description: Awesome bagel sandwiches. For $2.99 you get a egg and cheese "eggwich", for $.20 more you can have it on their pesto bagels, which are to die for!! My daughter loves to teethe on the plain bagels. And the people that work there are cute and friendly, and the service is quick, and always right!
author: Cate F.

description: These are not bagels, these are like Wonder bread.  They are not even made the way a bagel is made.  Got one this morning, threw it out.  Go up 18th to one of the coffee shops (La Taza) and you will find something much better.  Horrible.
author: Ruth F.

description: French toast bagels. That's all I have to say. I got one once with maple cream cheese and it was a very very good day.
author: Michael E.

description: Very good bagels + flirty staff + cruisey castro location, triple good.
author: Stellah D.

description: I went for the first time today since it's right down the street. The bagel I had was cheap and tasty, which is a total plus in my book. However, the woman behind the counter was a bit cold and didn't really seem to care for the job much. I can totally sympathesize when you deal with people all day. I would definitely stop by here again if I wanted a quick, cheap bite to eat but would surely not go out of my way to stop in.
author: Bathrooms Only ..

description: Good & cheap lunch place - and I love their lox! If you think Subway's got the only "sandwich artists" in town, you've been missing out on the sandwich makers of Posh Bagels. Impressive! How come my fancy sandwiches never turn out so tasty?
author: Anika K.

description: Ahh posh bagel. Why is your food so yummy and your service so terrible? I order my breakfast there at least once a week before work, and they always screw up my order. Screwing up a bagel with butter takes some talent, but they always pull it off. I keep coming back because I am a bagel fanatic and there is no other place that I know of on the street to get a bagel.
author: Rachel S.

description: I love coming here in the mornings and ordering the bacon with egg bagel sandwich! YUM! It fills you up and you feel satisfied as you are on your way to a long day of classes! The staff are friendly and inexpensive! When you walk in, you can smell all the goodness! There are so many choices you can chose from!
author: Mel P.

description: I had been harboring a hankering for Posh's gourmet Marinara and Pesto bagels.  I'd had them before in San Jose, but never here.  Alas, I bought a dozen to bring to work this morning and excitedly cut one in half, stuck it in the toaster, and turned the knob to toast- medium toast.  When the little oven's bell sounded, I slathered on the cream cheese and started chowing down... and was dissapointed.  Whoever wrote that these bagels lack that chewy outside, which kind of makes a bagel a bagel, was right.  These bagels are dry and kind of like foccaccia bread to me.  The texture just wasn't doing it.  The spread was pretty good -- tomato basil, but I don't think I'll be revisiting this Posh.  I need to try the San Jose location again... maybe I just have bad taste in bagels?  Naaaah.
author: Sobrina T.

description: Went here at 10:00 am on a Friday morning.  No wait.  Ordered an everything with cream cheese.  Paid my $2, sat down and the bagel was ready to go immediately.  Good bagel, lots of cream cheese (note to whiners: just wipe the sh*t off, better to get too much than not enough and some of us actually appreciate it) and that's about all.  What you would expect in a bagel shop.
author: Zach J.

description: I came in for the first time a few weeks ago with my boyfriend and ordered the tuna melt bagel. Even though they seemed a little skeptical about my request for lettuce (because it wilts in the toaster) they accommodated me, and i got a really tasty sandwich as a result. The customer service was fine, but the girl behind the counter seemed a little stressed out. Either way, we got our food pretty quickly considering there was a line. Overall, it was a good experience, and I'm glad to have a bagel place in the neighborhood.
author: jessica f.

description:
If you're from the east coast and know what bagels are supposed to be you will be disappointed.  They just aren't right because they are too light and bread-y to be real bagels.  Safeway on Market actually had much better quality bagels than this place.

My bagel had a lump of cream cheese in the middle... would have been nice if they could spread it around for me.

I'll give them a second try, but I'm not impressed.  To be fair, I wasn't expecting to be impressed by west coast bagels.
author: S S.

description: i think it is funny that some people complain that there is too much creamcheese. some complain cause there is not enough. we are such a fickle bunch arent we? yeah, my bagel was okay. thats all i really have to say.
author: coffeecake j.

description: what kinda poeple give this place 3 or better?  do u hate me and want me to eat really bad things?  totally bad bagels, terrible non-english-speaking service, and slow to-go.  one good thing- i love the bagel dogs- but they buy them from another place, i saw it!
author: charlene l.

description: ok bagel place in the castro, they have the usual suspects by way of "bagel cuisine"  not to expenisive and a good selection of juice.
author: Denny R.

description: they just don't put enough cream cheese on the damn things.  a conservative application to of cream cheese to only one side of a bagel just does not do the trick.  i mean, i know i look like a skinny lil' bitch, but if i'm treating myself to a garlic bagel, then i want a whole grip of garlic herby cream cheese on the thing, cuz a boy deserves a special treat every now and then!  too bad this is the only place to get a bagel in the castro, cuz it is kinda dumpy and the service is well, icy...definitely not posh.
author: eric i.

description: These are not bagels. They are doughnut shaped hamburger buns. They looked funny and underbaked, but I thought they would taste OK... wrong. After one bite, bagels were in the garbage.
author: Lawrence L.

description: never get a bagel from here, unless you like to eat crap.
author: Andrew K.
